KeyVault Overview

Table of Contents

  • Introduction to KeyVault
  • Thread Safety
  • Key Vault Classes

Introduction to KeyVault

The KeyVault module supports local, temporary, secure storage of data protection keys. The primary use case for storing keys locally is to enable the ability to access those keys while being temporarily offline (no internet / network access).

Thread Safety

KeyVaultLib is thread-safe. All classes in the KeyVault module are thread-safe and may be used as a shared resource between concurrent threads. Additionally, the underlying storage mechanisms are process-safe, which means a single key vault may be simultaneously used from multiple different processes on the same machine without data loss or data corruption.


Key Vault Classes

  • IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyVaultKey - A special key used by the keyvault that can be stored and used offline.
  • IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyVaultInterface - Pure interface definition that all key vaults must comply with.
  • IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyVaultNative - Abstract class that implements all interfaces from KeyVaultInterface but leaves storage logic unimplemented (responbility of sub-classes).
  • IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyVaultServicesCallback - Allows a dot net implementation to define their own keyvault
  • IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyVaultWindows - Windows key vault implementation that uses Windows DPAPI data protection to secure the key vault file.
  • IonicSecurity::SDK::KeyVaultTimeUtil - Utility class used for various time-related calculation functions useful for determining key issued and expiration time.
